Posting a Message: Selection of the post tab opens a Direct Read News posting page where new or reply messages can be sent to a newsgroup. If you click on the "Post Message" tab while you're in the main list of articles within a newsgroup, you will post an original message to the group. If you have opened a particular article within a newsgroup, and you've clicked on the "Post Reply" icon within that message, you will make a reply post to that specific message.

If the "Post Message" tab is selected while in a binary newsgroup, a slightly different posting form will appear with an "Attachment" field that will let you attach a binary file along with your post (photo file, sound file, movie file, etc.). In the event that you are in a text-only newsgroup, the posting form will not include this "Attachment" field.

Posting Form Description: A screen capture of the Direct Read News posting form appears below, along with a description of the individual fields and icons that make up the form. This is the form that would appear when posting to a binary specific newsgroup, and the only difference between this form and a text-only posting form would be the appearance of the "Attachment" field which would not be present on the text-only posting form.


  • Newsgroup: This field indicates the title of the newsgroup(s) you are posting to, and in this example, the posted message will go to the "alt.binaries.pictures.autos" group. If you wished to post your message to more than one newsgroup, you would place a comma (,) directly after the first newsgroup title in this field, then followed by the title of the next newsgroup. A blank space should not be included after the comma.

  • Subject: This is where you type in the title of your newsgroup message. If you are posting an original message to a newsgroup, this will field will be blank and you would simply type in the title of your message. In this example, the subject/title of the message is "Here's a photo of my '72 Pinto - mypinto.gif (1/1)". If you are replying to an existing message in a newsgroup, this field would display the subject/title of the original newsgroup message you are replying to, and an "Re:" would be inserted in front of the Subject line to indicate a reply message.

  • From: This is the real or fictitious name/address you elect to post your message with. In this example, the message is being posted by "Bob@somewhere.com", but the posting author could have elected to use another address (fake@name.com), a name like (Bob, Robert, etc.), a nickname (Mr. X, Bob-o-rama, etc.), or any combination of the above. This can be entered in a number of ways such as "Bob <Bob@somewhere.com>", "Bob@somewhere.com (Bob)", or "Bob@somewhere.com".

  • Organization: This text can be modified to include whatever real or fictitious information you desire.

  • Cc: (E-Mail): To copy your message to anyone, via e-mail, simply enter the desired recipient's e-mail address. This information will not be shown in your actual post, and is a good way to ensure the author of a post you are replying to sees your response.

  • Attachment: Direct Read News allows you to browse your local system for attachments. Simply click the "Browse" button and select a file name to attach to your post. If you forget to enter a file name within your subject line for the attachment, that information will automatically be inserted for you. Additionally, if you post a file which exceeds the default number of lines (7500), your file/post will automatically be broken into the correct number of lines and parts. If, for any reason, your post is not accepted and you get an on-screen message telling you to return to the post form to enter missing information, etc., please verify the attachment file name is still showing in the Attachment box. If it isn't showing, please click the Browse button again and re-select the filename.

  • X-No-Archive: There are several public sites on the Internet that retain newsgroup messages within their database, and allow Internet users to search that content. In the event that you do not wished to have your newsgroup postings archived within those databases, you would select this option prior to posting your message.

  • Post Message: After you have composed your text message within the posting form, or attached your binary file, you would click on this tab to post the message to a newsgroup.

  • Browse... : When posting a file attachment to a newsgroup, use the Browse button to locate the file on your local system. Once chosen the file name and location will appear in the Attachment field and included with your message when posted.

  • Help: Click here if you'd like access to the Direct Read News Help pages.

  • Message Field: This is the largest of the fields within the posting form, and it's where you would compose a message you wished to post to a newsgroup. If you are posting an original message, this entire field will be blank, and if you are posting a reply to an existing message within a newsgroup, this field will contain a copy of that original message so that other newsgroup users will be able to see the original comments you are replying to.

  • Post Signature: This field contains a signature that you would like to conclude your newsgroup messages with. In this example, the posting author has elected to include their name, email address, and website address, but you can choose to put whatever information you like in this field, or leave it blank.
